resourceManager

Class ResourceSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • resourceManager.ResourceSystem

  • public class ResourceSystem
extends java.lang.Object
    A resource system consists of a number of ResourceManagers, each managing an individual Resource, and a number of ResourceUsers, who wish to make use of the resources.

    Resource users may request access to a resource through the resource's resource manager, but only one resource user is allowed access to a given resource at any one time. If the resource is in use the requesting resource user must wait until the resource becomes available again. Access requests are made with a given priority. When a resource becomes available by a resource user releasing the resource the resource manager will determine if there are any processes waiting for access. If there are, the resource manager must determine the highest priority of all pending access requests, and only allow access to one of the resource users who made one of these highest priority requests.

    Note that the priorities are associated with the access requests, not with the resource users. One resource user may, make a number of access requests at different times with differing priorities.

    Note also that there is currently an error in the code in addResource(String, int), the implementation of which requires a full implementation of the ResourceManager interface to be available, which is not available in the bundle as provided.

    Version:
    February 2020
    Author:
    Hugh Osborne

    • Field Detail

      • managers

        private java.util.Set<ResourceManager> managers
        The set of managers managing the resources to be used by the resource users. Since each resource manager manages a single resource this also implicitly defines the set of resources in the system.

      • users

        private java.util.Set<ResourceUser> users
        The set of resource users in the system.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ResourceSystem

        public ResourceSystem()
        Initialise the resource managers and resource users sets.

    • Method Detail

      • addResource

        public void addResource(java.lang.String name,
                        int maxUseages)
        Add a new resource by creating one, with the appropriate manager.

        Note: when you have a full implementation of ResourceManager (e.g. in a PriorityResourceManager class) you should replace the erroneous call of the (non-existent) ResourceManager constructor with a call of the corresponding constructor from your class.

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the resource to be added.
        maxUseages - the maximum number of times this resource can be used (the actual number may be lower - see BasicResourceManager.BasicResourceManager(Resource, int).)

      • addUser

        public void addUser(java.lang.String name,
                    double maxDelay)
        Add a new resource user. The resource user may make use of all the resources created.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the resource user.
        maxDelay - the maximum time, in seconds, that the resource user will ever use any resource.

      • run

        public void run()
         throws ResourceError
        Run this resource user. Each resource user will run until all the resources at its disposal are exhausted.
        Throws:
        ResourceError - if there is an InterruptedException while the system waits to join() the resource users.
